page.title: 09Farming practices
page.content: Most local farmers farm mixed farms, having both arable and beef or sheep. There are two dairy herds but this is not a traditionally milk producing area and the recently introduced milk quota system has reduced the numbers of cows in these herds. Most local farmers used to fatten Hereford/cross calves but recently more are turning to the bigger Continental crosses which take longer to fatten.The calves are shedded from October to May and the majority are fed silage, either from a clamp or in big bales. Store sheep are commonly bought in in August but prices were high in 1985 and few store sheep are around. Sheep are also kept for their lambs, born around February,and their wool. Sheep have had to be dipped twice this year to eradicate scab, a highly infectious disease.
